original: @42a * // bcom ldan 'das dpal phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽don rnams ma lus sgrub byed pa'i //
analyzed: @42a * // bcom ldan 'das dpal phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo // don rnams ma lus sgrub byed pa'i //
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽The means of accomplishment of the vajra conqueror,

original: don grub rdo rje rnam 'joms kyi /
analyzed: don grub rdo rje rnam 'joms kyi /
translated: which accomplishes all goals without exception,

original: sgrub pa'i thabs ni bshad par bya //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs ni bshad par bya //
translated: will be explained.🔽The magical emanations of non-humans,

original: 'byung po ro langs sha bra dang // mkha' 'gro ma dang brjed byed ma //
analyzed: 'byung po ro langs sha bra dang // mkha' 'gro ma dang brjed byed ma //
translated: such as bhūtas, vetālas, piśācas,🔽ḍākinīs, ḍākas,

original: smyo byed srin po la sogs pa'i //🔽mi ma yin gyi sprul pa las //
analyzed: smyo byed srin po la sogs pa'i // mi ma yin gyi sprul pa las //
translated: unmādas, rākṣasas, and so forth,

original: rnam par thar par byed pa yi //
analyzed: rnam par thar par byed pa yi //
translated: are liberated

original: gzungs kyi cho ga legs pa ni //
analyzed: gzungs kyi cho ga legs pa ni //
translated: by the excellent ritual of the dhāraṇī

original: rgyud la brten nas bshad par bya //
analyzed: rgyud la brten nas bshad par bya //
translated: based on the tantra.

original: 'dir 'phags pa rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa la brten pa'i rang rtags kyi las bdun gyi cho ga dang por bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa la brten pa'i rang rtags kyi las bdun gyi cho ga dang por bshad par bya'o //
translated: Here, first the ritual of the seven self-accomplished activities based on the noble Vajravidāraṇa should be explained.🔽A practitioner who possesses the samaya should first make offerings to Vajrapāṇi

original: rnal 'byor pa dam tshig dang ldan pas sngon du phyag na rdo rje'am /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dam tshig dang ldan pas sngon du phyag na rdo rje'am /
translated: A yogi who possesses the commitments should first make offerings to Vajrapani.🔽

original: 'di nyid kyi snying po rgyas bsdus la bsnyen pa tshad du phyin pas gnas khang yid dang mthun par 'byung la sogs pas chag chag legs par byas la srog chags med pa'i me tog sngon po'i gcal legs par bkram la rin po che'i mandal gyi steng du /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi snying po rgyas bsdus la bsnyen pa tshad du phyin pas gnas khang yid dang mthun par 'byung la sogs pas chag chag legs par byas la srog chags med pa'i me tog sngon po'i gcal legs par bkram la rin po che'i mandal gyi steng du /
translated: Having completed the recitation of the extensive or concise essence mantra, one should sprinkle the place with water that is agreeable to the mind, and so forth.

original: mchod pa lnga dbul par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa lnga dbul par bya'o //
translated: One should strew a floor covering of blue flowers that are free of living beings, and offer the five offerings on a jeweled mandala.

original: de nas rang gi bla ma dang yi dam la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mdun gyi nam mkha' la spyan drangs la /
analyzed: de nas rang gi bla ma dang yi dam la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mdun gyi nam mkha' la spyan drangs la /
translated: Then, one should invite one’s guru, chosen deity, and so forth, the buddhas and bodhisattvas, into the space in front.

original: skyabs 'gro sems bskyed dang bdun rnam par dag pa bya'o //
analyzed: skyabs 'gro sems bskyed dang bdun rnam par dag pa bya'o //
translated: One should go for refuge, arouse the mind of awakening, and perform the seven-branch service.

original: de nas bdag nyid stong pa'i nga rgyal du bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid stong pa'i nga rgyal du bya ste /
translated: Then, one should perform the pride of emptiness.

original: srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgom pa dang / bgegs rnams la bka' sgo ba la sogs pa bya ste /
analyzed: srung ba'i 'khor lo bsgom pa dang / bgegs rnams la bka' sgo ba la sogs pa bya ste /
translated: One should meditate on the protection wheel, give commands to the obstructors, and so forth.

original: h'um zhes mig byin gyis brlab ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: h'um zhes mig byin gyis brlab ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: One should perform the consecration of the eyes, and so forth, with hūṃ.

original: de nas bsrung ba chen po'i sngags lan bcur brjod la phyogs bcing ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsrung ba chen po'i sngags lan bcur brjod la phyogs bcing ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Then, recite the mantra of the great protection ten times and do the binding of the directions, and so forth.

original: de'i rjes la bdag dang dngos po thams cad stong par mos par bya /
analyzed: de'i rjes la bdag dang dngos po thams cad stong par mos par bya /
translated: After that, imagine that oneself and all things are empty.

original: de nas sgrub pa po khrus sngon du song bas /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa po khrus sngon du song bas /
translated: Then, the practitioner, having performed ablutions beforehand,

original: nye reg dang 'thor 'thung la sogs pa byas la tshad med pa bzhi bsgom /
analyzed: nye reg dang 'thor 'thung la sogs pa byas la tshad med pa bzhi bsgom /
translated: should perform the near-purity, sprinkling and sipping water, and so forth, and meditate on the four immeasurables.

original: de rjes stong pa'i dang las h'um las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de rjes stong pa'i dang las h'um las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: After that, from emptiness, a sun maṇḍala arises from hūṃ.

original: de'i steng du h'um las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje //
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje //
translated: On that, a vajra cross arises from hūṃ.

original: de'i lte ba la bhr'um las rin po che'i gzhal yas khang rab tu rgya che zhing kha dog gsal ba rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: de'i lte ba la bhr'um las rin po che'i gzhal yas khang rab tu rgya che zhing kha dog gsal ba rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa /
translated: In its center, a precious celestial mansion arises from bhrūṃ, very vast, clear in color, and adorned with various ornaments,

original: ye shes bzhi 'bar bar byed pa'i sa gzhi dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes bzhi 'bar bar byed pa'i sa gzhi dang bcas pa'o //
translated: together with a ground that blazes with the four pristine consciousnesses.

original: de'i dbus ma dang aa las byung ba'i nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de @42b nyid kyi steng du h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje sngon po /
analyzed: de'i dbus ma dang aa las byung ba'i nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de @42b nyid kyi steng du h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje sngon po /
translated: The hūṃ-syllable transforms into a blue vajra, the size of a grain, with open prongs.

original: nas tsam kha gyes la de nyid 'phros 'dus pa las badzra h'um zhes pas lan bdun brjod pas h'um las byung ba'i stobs po che sku mdog mthing ga zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa dpal rdo rje rnam par 'joms pas dbu brgyan pa /
analyzed: nas tsam kha gyes la de nyid 'phros 'dus pa las badzra h'um zhes pas lan bdun brjod pas h'um las byung ba'i stobs po che sku mdog mthing ga zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa dpal rdo rje rnam par 'joms pas dbu brgyan pa /
translated: That vajra emanates and reabsorbs, and through reciting “vajra hūṃ” seven times, the hūṃ-syllable transforms into Mahābala, who is blue, with one face and four hands, and is crowned with glorious Vajravidāraṇa.

original: tho ba dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang / sdigs mdzub me 'bar ba dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: tho ba dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang / sdigs mdzub me 'bar ba dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: He is contemplated as having the mudras of a hammer, a lasso, a skull cup, and a blazing-fire threatening gesture.

original: de nas ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang gnyis su med par brtan par bya ba dang / mchod pa lnga dbul /
analyzed: de nas ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang gnyis su med par brtan par bya ba dang / mchod pa lnga dbul /
translated: Then, the awareness beings enter, one becomes inseparable with the visualized form, and the five offerings are presented.🔽Recite the praise:

original: rdo rje rnam par 'joms ba la bstod pa /
analyzed: rdo rje rnam par 'joms ba la bstod pa /
translated: Homage to the vajra of wrath🔽who destroys all evildoers.

original: bdag nyid tha mal pa'i lus su slar langs la /
analyzed: bdag nyid tha mal pa'i lus su slar langs la /
translated: Then, one’s ordinary body arises again.

original: 'dod pa'i don yid la byas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don yid la byas te /
translated: With a focused mind, one should recite the following:

original: ye shes kyi 'khor lo las bdud rtsi'i chu rgyun phab ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'khor lo las bdud rtsi'i chu rgyun phab ste /
translated: The stream of elixir descends from the awareness being’s body.🔽It dissolves into the top of your head and fills your body to the soles of your feet.

original: bdag nyid lus mgo mjug tu bstims pas las dang nyon mongs pa'i dri ma rnam par dag par byas la /
analyzed: bdag nyid lus mgo mjug tu bstims pas las dang nyon mongs pa'i dri ma rnam par dag par byas la /
translated: It purifies all the stains of karma and mental afflictions.

original: de'i rjes la bdag dang gang bsrung ba'i lus dang yan lag thams cad rdo rje mi chod pa'i go cha dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la bdag dang gang bsrung ba'i lus dang yan lag thams cad rdo rje mi chod pa'i go cha dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: After that, you and the person for whom you are performing the protection should don the armor of the indestructible vajra.

original: de nas mandal gyi steng du snying po lnga dang ldan pa'i bum pa'i nang du chu gtsang ma srog chags med pas bkang /🔽dri dang 'bru la sogs pa bum pa la shis pa'i rdzas rnams kyis legs par bltams la /
analyzed: de nas mandal gyi steng du snying po lnga dang ldan pa'i bum pa'i nang du chu gtsang ma srog chags med pas bkang / dri dang 'bru la sogs pa bum pa la shis pa'i rdzas rnams kyis legs par bltams la /
translated: Then, on top of the mandala, fill a vase with the five essences and clean water free of living organisms.🔽It should be well filled with substances that are auspicious for the vase, such as saffron and grain.🔽It should be beautified with the vase ornaments, such as a garland and a mirror.

original: kha rgyan dang mgul chings la sogs pa'i bum pa'i rgyan rnams kyis mdzes par byas la rab tu dri zhim pa dang ldan pa'i snying po bris la h'um yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: kha rgyan dang mgul chings la sogs pa'i bum pa'i rgyan rnams kyis mdzes par byas la rab tu dri zhim pa dang ldan pa'i snying po bris la h'um yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: Draw the essence mantra on a fragrant flower and visualize it as a hūṃ.

original: stobs po cher rnam par blta'o //
analyzed: stobs po cher rnam par blta'o //
translated: It completely transforms into Mahābala.

original: gzhan gyis longs ma spyad pa'i kham phor kha sbyar yungs kar gyis bkang la bsgrub bya'i ming rus gro ga la bris la gi wang gis dril la gzhag go //
analyzed: gzhan gyis longs ma spyad pa'i kham phor kha sbyar yungs kar gyis bkang la bsgrub bya'i ming rus gro ga la bris la gi wang gis dril la gzhag go //
translated: One should fill a clay bowl that has not been used by anyone else with mustard seeds, and one should write the name and gotra of the victim on birch bark, and roll it with gaurī, and place it there.

original: de nas bdag nyid kyi srin lag g-yon ba la gzungs thag btags te /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid kyi srin lag g-yon ba la gzungs thag btags te /
translated: Then one should tie the dhāraṇī thread to one’s left ring finger.

original: kha bshal zhing khrus dang gtsang spra la gnas par byas la /
analyzed: kha bshal zhing khrus dang gtsang spra la gnas par byas la /
translated: One should rinse one’s mouth, and one should maintain cleanliness and purity.

original: bzlas pa bya ste /
analyzed: bzlas pa bya ste /
translated: One should recite the mantra.🔽One should visualize that the mantra’s own sound is complete in the hollow of a blue vajra the size of a chickpea on top of the practitioner’s tongue, and one should visualize that appearances also have the nature of a vajra, endowed with the mantra’s own sound.

original: sgrub pa po'i lce'i steng du rdo rje sngon po nas tsam gyi sbubs ma nas sngags kyi rang sgra rdzogs par byas la snang ba rnams kyang rdo rje lta bur gsang sngags kyi rang sgra dang ldan par dmigs la bdag dang stobs po che gnyis su med par
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i lce'i steng du rdo rje sngon po nas tsam gyi sbubs ma nas sngags kyi rang sgra rdzogs par byas la snang ba rnams kyang rdo rje lta bur gsang sngags kyi rang sgra dang ldan par dmigs la bdag dang stobs po che gnyis su med par
translated: One should make oneself nondual with Mahābala,

original: byas la / aom sarba bady'i badzra badzra da ra da ra badzra h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a zhes brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bsngags la /
analyzed: byas la / aom sarba bady'i badzra badzra da ra da ra badzra h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a zhes brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bsngags la /
translated: and one should enchant one hundred and eight times with oṃ sarvavid vajra dara dara vajra hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: bsgrub bya'i ming rus la @43a * //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i ming rus la @43a * //
translated: One should write the name and gotra of the victim on birch bark with gaurī, and one should place it in the clay bowl.

original: gu gul gyi chus bkru zhing nges par blos byas pas /
analyzed: gu gul gyi chus bkru zhing nges par blos byas pas /
translated: If one washes with guggula water and definitely does this mentally,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: one will accomplish whatever one desires.

original: sngags kyi rjes la bdag la nad dang dug dang mtshon la sogs pa rnams kyis mi chod par mdzad du gsol zhes gro ga la 'khor lo bris te mgul du yungs kar dang btags na mtshon la sogs pa rnams las rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags kyi rjes la bdag la nad dang dug dang mtshon la sogs pa rnams kyis mi chod par mdzad du gsol zhes gro ga la 'khor lo bris te mgul du yungs kar dang btags na mtshon la sogs pa rnams las rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After the mantra, one should write on birchbark, “Please do not let me be cut by illness, poison, weapons, and so on,” and tie it around one’s neck with white mustard seed. One will be victorious over weapons and so on.

original: sdig pa dag par 'dod na chu gtsang ma la bsngags te ltor btang na bskal ba bdun gyi sdig ba ma lus pa zad par byed do //
analyzed: sdig pa dag par 'dod na chu gtsang ma la bsngags te ltor btang na bskal ba bdun gyi sdig ba ma lus pa zad par byed do //
translated: If one wishes to purify evil, one should incant clean water and drink it. It will eliminate all the evil of seven eons without exception.

original: de ltar 'dir byung ba'i cho ga las lan gsum gsum gyis nyi ma re re la rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir byung ba'i cho ga las lan gsum gsum gyis nyi ma re re la rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: In this way, one should perform the rite that occurs here three times each day.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba thams cad las thar bar nges so //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba thams cad las thar bar nges so //
translated: One will certainly be freed from all evil and nonvirtue.

original: de bzhin du sbrul gyis zin ba dang rma dang 'bras la sogs ba la ba ser mo'i 'o mas sbrus pa'i 'jim pa la nyin mtshan gsum du bzlas te phyugs na de nyid las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbrul gyis zin ba dang rma dang 'bras la sogs ba la ba ser mo'i 'o mas sbrus pa'i 'jim pa la nyin mtshan gsum du bzlas te phyugs na de nyid las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if one has been bitten by a snake, or has a wound, a boil, etc., one should knead clay with the milk of a yellow cow, incant it one hundred and eight times, and apply it; one will be freed from that very [ailment].

original: de ltar na rlung dang chu chen po dang ser ba drag po 'bab cing gzhan gyis chod par dka' ba rnams la yungs kar la bsngags nas gtor na gzhan gyis mi chod pa rnams kyang chod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rlung dang chu chen po dang ser ba drag po 'bab cing gzhan gyis chod par dka' ba rnams la yungs kar la bsngags nas gtor na gzhan gyis mi chod pa rnams kyang chod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if a great wind, great flood, or great hail falls, and it is difficult for others to stop it, one should incant white mustard seeds, scatter [the seeds], and even what is difficult for others to stop will be stopped.

original: gzhan yang bdag nyid kyi rig sngags kyi las ma grub pa rnams kyang 'di nyid kyi cho ga zhag bdun 'bad na gzhan gyis sbyad par dka' ba'i las 'grub par nges so //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid kyi rig sngags kyi las ma grub pa rnams kyang 'di nyid kyi cho ga zhag bdun 'bad na gzhan gyis sbyad par dka' ba'i las 'grub par nges so //
translated: Moreover, even if one's own mantra rites are not accomplished, if one exerts oneself for seven days with just this rite, it is certain that the rites difficult for others to perform will be accomplished.

original: spyir gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i gsang sngags dang rig sngags thams cad las gzungs sngags kyi las thams cad la 'di nyid la sngon du rdzogs par byas nas rang gi las la sbyar ba gang yin pa sbyar na 'grub par 'gyur ba la the tshom med par
analyzed: spyir gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i gsang sngags dang rig sngags thams cad las gzungs sngags kyi las thams cad la 'di nyid la sngon du rdzogs par byas nas rang gi las la sbyar ba gang yin pa sbyar na 'grub par 'gyur ba la the tshom med par
translated: In general, for all the activities of secret mantra and knowledge mantra that harm others, having first completed this [rite] and applied it to one's own activity, if one applies it, there is no doubt that it will be accomplished.

original: gzhan gyis spyad par dka' ba'i las 'grub par nges so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis spyad par dka' ba'i las 'grub par nges so //
translated: It is certain that the activity that is difficult for others to perform will be accomplished.

original: sgrub pa po'i lus dang ngag dang sems yongs su dag par bya ba ni rab tu gtso ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i lus dang ngag dang sems yongs su dag par bya ba ni rab tu gtso ba'o //
translated: Purifying the body, speech, and mind of the practitioner is very important.

original: mi chod ba zhes bya ba'i rgyud kyi tshig sgrub thabs su phyung ba slob dpon ye shes rdo rjes mdzad pa dpal rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa'i las la sbyar ba 'grub par nges pa'i cho ga rdzogs so//
analyzed: mi chod ba zhes bya ba'i rgyud kyi tshig sgrub thabs su phyung ba slob dpon ye shes rdo rjes mdzad pa dpal rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa'i las la sbyar ba 'grub par nges pa'i cho ga rdzogs so//
translated: The words of the Tantra called Uncuttable extracted as a means of accomplishment, composed by the master Jñānavajra, are the complete rite for applying to the activity of glorious Vajravidāraṇa, which is certain to be accomplished.
